alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 12:44PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wayne County through 115 PM MDT... At 1244 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Capitol Reef National Park, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Capitol Reef National Park, Caineville and Fruita. This includes Utah Route 24 between mile markers 78 and 91, and between mile markers 95 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Western Canyonlands
